Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice motel”
Reviews.Author: Celeste_14
Reviews.Content: The one thing that stood out for me with this motel was how friendly the staff were, especially the reception guys. The room itself was large with plenty of room to store your belongings. The bathroom was a bit dated but that was not an issue for me. The free breakfast each morning was good, only that most people had to stand up as the room was tiny! They motel provided free parking and the area was close to public transport. One problem was the walls were paper thin, there was a lady down 5 doors that loved to call all her friends at midnight, we could cleary here her. She also invited a friend around one night... anyhow, it would help if the wall were a bit thicker. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very reasonable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: philcophil
Reviews.Content: very reasonable and friendly staff great location good parking try the Happy Family Chinese restaurant one block east for exotic Chinese food

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea J
Reviews.Content: We come to this property every time we are in Vancouver. We enjoy the value since it is generally a clean, quiet, and convenient hotel to stay at. There is a service station close and a McDonald's right next store so late night snacking and late breakfast are easy to find. The desk staff are always friendly, willing to accommodate any needs, and very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pawel J
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Days Inn Vancouver Metro only 2 days, but people at the front desk help me a lot. They stored my baggage for a couple of hours, and always knew the direction to the places I wanted to get to :) The breakfast is OK, but sometimes there is not enough food because of many travellers. One big con: The shower sink was broken, I had to call twice and finally someone came, but he wasn't able to repair it. Oh.. and I got to queen bad instead of one, heh ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Andrey Y
Reviews.Content: Nice and inexpensive hotel in the heart of Greater Vancouver. Clean, neat, free internet access, refrigerator and coffee maker in room, plenty of free parking. The only downside is the meager breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great for a cheap, clean place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Dara86
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Days Inn more than 6 times and every time its just great. CLEAN, CHEAP, and close to Metrotown. Its defiently not a 4 or 5 star but you get what you pay for. I would definitely recommend this location and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “...Ugh..”
Reviews.Author: Nicki S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn because it was near the mall. The room had a awful smell, housekeeping had no extra towels and the staff was incredibly rude. We had called to inform them we would be arriving very late and when we arrived our reservation was cancelled as a no show. When we asked for directions, again the staff didn't know. I found the staff to be incredibly incompetent and rude. The parking situation is also a nightmare, small cars only that's for sure. And the cleanliness was questionable, finding hair is always unsettling.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you´ve paid for”
Reviews.Author: PeterXAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in this hotel . It is quite far away from Vancouver Downtown . Lots of Asian restaurants and Take Aways nearby. Spacious parking on site. Rooms are clean . The bathroom needs refurbishment and is very small . The steps to the breakfast room in the cellar are rather steep. Not to recommend for elderly clients. Anyway, you book Days Inn , you get similar standard everywhere, the price was okay , so no need to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: AkhilSo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days recently and we were pleasantly surprised by the amenities offered by the hotel for the price we paid. They have free parking ,free high speed wifi internet in the room and free continental breakfast. The rooms were clean and there are lot of restaurants nearby. Overall we enjoyed the stay and will highly recommend this place .

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Cberry8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in a queen room. There have been some updates to the hotel but they are strictly cosmetic. The floors squeaked and sagged in places. The room was clean and the location worked for us. Would I stay again? Maybe but not likely. The walls were very thin and you can hear everything in the hall way and on the street.

Reviews.Title: “An honestly good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: care2dance
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed there a few times, totaling about 7 days. For the price its truly a steal, and I paid around $45 a night there. Reservations are flawless, staff efficient and friendly, staff being front office and the cleaning staff. Its hard to spot, but the management are apparently and very quietly renovating in some areas. Rooms are clean and well-made, with things you wouldn't expect at such low price, such as large flat panel televisions and free Internet. Ive spent twice as much in Vancouver for rooms not even half as good as these. Plenty of hot water, quiet, good services (electrical, telephone, heating, etc.). Its on Kingsway, a major street with restaurants and banking on the same block, and the way the hotel is situated minimized road noise. I wasn't bothered in the slightest, and I hate noise. I also appreciated the non-smoking environment. This hotel is a best in its class.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to Visit Family”
Reviews.Author: KCSantaClara
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel 2 to 3 times per year to visit family due to its close proximity to our family. Each stay is usually between 7 to 10 days. The free internet allows us to continue our work also. The biggest change we noticed this time is the smoke-free policy for all rooms – that is a big plus. We decided to stay at the Family Suite this time. The bedroom did not have a dresser or TV. However, it was still great to have the extra living room to work and watched the Grey Cup. The downside we found during this stay was the cleanliness of the linen. We had “stale/rotten” odor in the bathroom. We only learned the odor was from the shower curtain towards the end of our stay. The brown bedspread in the bedroom had white stains on it, but the housekeeper just turned it over every time instead of changing it. We also noticed some towels had permanent stains on them even though they were freshly cleaned. The housekeeping service was inconsistent – some days were good and some days were obviously rushed. Improvement area: Train the housekeepers to change bedspread with stains on it and inspect the shower curtain for cleanliness. Add a small dresser under the closet rail in the Family Suite bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BigAussie6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with two queen beds which gave us plenty of room to spread out our luggage etc. The hotel rate included free wireless internet and free parking which were my main criteria. The free breakfast was a bonus. Having a car meant the location was not a problem although we found it was not too far from downtown. We ate at the Green Lettuce restaurant just a short walk down the road a couple of times and food was cheap, plentiful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “overall a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ranmca
Reviews.Content: the price of this hotel cannot be beat, and for that reason i think it is a good value. the hotel was very clean and had a great courtyard in the middle of all the rooms. the room we stayed in smelt really bad like bathroom but we only slept there so it was not a huge deal. it was nice to have a refrigerator in the room. a few problems we found with the place: it was very loud at night...we woke up many times during the night because of people slamming doors and in the morning because of people going to breakfast, but thats not at all the hotels fault, just stupid people. another thing that we didnt like was the breakfast room. the breakfast itself was very good. they have bagels,toast,cereal,muffins,pastries,juice...very yummy...but eveyday we went down for breakfast we had nowhere to sit. we tried going early,going late, and still no place to sit, and so crowded. i spilt my plate because someone bumped into me...there just was no room. also we found it hard to find places to eat. this hotel is close to mcdonalds and a vietnamese restaurant but if you dont want that kind of food you have to travel a ways to find something else. we did however find a subway north of the hotel(it was a drive) and ended up eating there most nights. the pros: the staff was very nice, even the cleaning maids were saying goodmorning to us every morning, the rooms were very clean, lots of parking, beautiful courtyard, great continental breakfast, affordable. i would stay at this hotel again, and wouldnt hesitate to reccomend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value with a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: swcgy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be in a good location,away from downtown,but still close enough to it.The access is excellent with buses running frequently, and the skytrain is a 10 to 15 minute walk (Nanaimo Station).There are some very good restaurants in the area,depending on what you like.East Vancouver has a large Vietnamese and Asian population,so there are all sorts of restaurants.The hotel is located next to McDonald's which I did not mind at all. My room was located near the back of the complex,a quiet location with 2 double beds,a flatscreen television with cable,and a mini-fridge.When I entered the room,I smelled a foul smell, like smoke or something,covered up by room freshener.I looked under the bed and noticed a gel airwick room freshener.The front desk did call me to ask how the room was and I pointed out that I was sensitive to smells and noticed this.She told me all the rooms were like that and offered to take out the air fresheners if that is what I wanted.I left them there to see if I would get used to them over the next few days and eventually I did get used to it.The hotel definitely needs to take care of this. The floors were creaky also, and although the hotel has made some cosmetic improvements, this is an area that needs some updating.One night I had the television on and it was not loud, yet the neighbour tapped on my wall.I was surprised that they could hear it, even at that level. The breakfast room is very small, but clean and newer.It was crowded during the times I ate there.The selection of food was just ok but nothing special.Why not offer some oatmeal? There is hot water there and it would be so easy to add this, as many people do like oatmeal for breakfast. When I arrived the lady at the front desk told me that my Wyndham points could not be added to this stay.The next day I mentioned it to another front desk agent who told me he would add my points.After looking at my receipt on check-out,I noticed that it said my points would not be added to this stay.It would be a good idea for the hotel to brief their agents on what is, and what is not, a "qualified" stay. I do want to mention the excellent service and wonderful smiles I received from the room cleaning staff.They made it all worthwhile! I found overall,that Days Inn Metro is good value for money paid, and I would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the value”
Reviews.Author: Huning
Reviews.Content: It's Days Inn and it's only ~$66/night in urban Vancouver. So I didn't expect more. The hotel features a central courtyard and all access to the room is directly from the outside. When it rains, make sure you bring your umbrella. It also offers free parking, free internet and free breakfast. Some other locations like downtown and Richmond will charge you $10-$30 for parking. I heard from locals that the area is not that safe but I didn't feel that. Internet is a little bit slow but still usable. Breakfast is in a very small room suits ~10 people. So, I've seen other guests without a seat. The meal is very minimal -- cereal, coffee, bread, bagel and juice. The room is okay. Beds are comfortable. It also has LCD TV, and a mini fridge. The bathroom is really small: 1 shower, 1 toilet, 1 sink and you need to squeeze in. Overall, for that price, it's a nice budget choice in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations confirmed”
Reviews.Author: timeflyer
Reviews.Content: The selection of the Days Inn Metro was based on the following factors: 1) good Trip Advisor rating; 2) vicinity to Downtown; 3) free parking; 4) easy to reach from the airport (even without a GPS navigator and after an intercontinental flight). The choiche turned out to be a very good one, since all these expectations were confirmed. The place is clean, the staff is corteous and helpful, and the free breakfast is better than average. Our room was on the 2nd floor and had an outside window on the back facing a McDonald's parking lot, but it did not disturb our sleep The only non positive remark are: 1) the lack of an independent heating system in the bathroom, so that the entire room needs to be overheated to assure a comfortable temperature in the shower; and 2) the lack of an elevator to reach the 2nd floor or the breakfast room in the basement. I stayed previously in this property (2006) and I would gladly return if the case.

Reviews.Title: “Good prices and service.”
Reviews.Author: mclaren_john1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Septemebr 28th for 7 nights. Clean and comfortable rooms, beds were very comfortable. Breakfast room very small, however we never had to wait for a table. Bus stop only 50 yards straight to downtown for $2.50, or skytrain station at Nanaimo only a 10 minute walk, all very accessable. Overall would recommend to anyone looking for good, clean, reasonably price accommodation, will use again when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Know your location”
Reviews.Author: michellejeanette
Reviews.Content: The Motel had a nice entrance, but not wheelchair friendly or suitcase friendly, only steps. The courtyard garden is lovely. Our room was small, and was full of ciggerette odour, Reception rang soon after we arrived to check if everything was OK, I asked if it was a smoking room, she said No, I told her about the smell, she said it couldn't be helped if people smoked outside the room. after that evening I began to feel very ill, I went to the front desk and asked to change rooms, or be given a full refund, he was very reluctant, and said can you wait until morning, I said No, Another person came out of the back office and gave us another room, no smoke smell and no Asthma. If the smoking seat and bin was removed from outside of the room we were first given and another area set aside from all rooms, there would not be a problem. The motel is a good distance from the city area, the motel provided us with bus and train directions which was very helpful. Public transport is very cheap. I thought Metro, would have been closer to the city centre, this was my mistake, so take in that it is a good 30 to 40 minutes to Vancouver city. This reflects in the Motel price. Small rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money was a little off but definatly worth a try”
Reviews.Author: aleanef
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night in September and was very pleased with the cleanliness and the courtyard which was a gorgeous touch. The free breakfast was a pleasant surprise - the area is not the best but not so bad I felt uncomfortable with my best friend and 13 yr old sister at night. When we had to go in the side door at night we were a little worried we'd be locked, directions or a sign for the side entrance would be helpful. The room I was in was quite small but clean and comfortable so we didn't mind - overall it was a pleasant experience but I don't really fell like I got what I payed for.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room - Tiny Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: thomas29144
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet room. Very Narrow driveway entry. Desk staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget place close to major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Jay_as_tripvisor
Reviews.Content: We really loved this place. It is close to all major attractions. The staff is really nice and courteous. We were on the 2nd floor. Decent size rooms with good beds. Breakfast was severed. Has a parking lot and is free. The vicinity is not that great but just OK. We saw a lot of vitenamese stores around and samll houses in the neighbourhood. Overall, very good place and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: montrealkristen
Reviews.Content: This started off as being a disaster. We arrived very late, and were given room 108. WOW what a stench. It was so bad I refused to stay in it. It was a mixture of an entire bottle of Pine Sol spilled on the carpet, and mildew. Made me want to vomit the minute we arrived. We were told we could switch rooms in the morning. I did not accept that, and asked if they could sleep in there with that smell. Yes, I brought the hotel staff to the room. I was told I could not switch til the morning. I then said I wanted my money back, and would sleep in the car. Suddenly we were given a different room. It was a very small room, but didn't reak. Good thing we were not there for more then 2 nights. As for the area...a little shady.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Oni0n
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Days Inn Metro Vancouver was quite pleasant. The hotel is located at the major intersection of Victoria and Kingsway in the middle of the city approx. a 10 min drive from downtown. It is centrally located in the city and therefore conveniently located for assess to many different areas around of the city. The rooms were clean and even had a with a refrigerator in each room. The rooms surround a small courtyard which is quite pretty. They offer free parking, wii fii and a continental breakfast. There is a McDonalds right next door and many small restaurants and cafes within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well presented, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Heidi Z
Reviews.Content: Only about 7km from center and is one of the nicest Days Inn we have stayed in. Rooms are refurbished, beds are clean and has a lovely courtyard garden. Free breakfast is decent and price of room is reasonable. Only negative was that it is not suitable for disabled access and many staircases makes it hard to lug large suitcases around.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and free parking”
Reviews.Author: Pom1212
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find any availability in Vancouver for the weekend -- so happy we didn't ! This hotel was easy to get to, had lots of free parking, a decent breakfast and clean, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “NIce courtyard, Poor breakfast room, Poor shower.”
Reviews.Author: juxpin
Reviews.Content: The inner courtyard is very well kept. It has lots of different colored impatiens and a variety of other plants, trees, and bushes. Staff was friendly and courteous. The breakfast room was almost unusable when busy mainly due to lack of space. There are too many tables for a small room like that which makes it very difficult to get around. I suggest using one long row of tables joined together with chairs on both sides instead of a bunch of 2 person tables. This would allow more seating and more room for people to walk up to the counter to get seconds. Some other fruit besides apples would be nice. And how about some yogurt? The shower in our room was very difficult to use. Any time we showered the water temperature fluctuated from cold to almost scalding. This made showering very difficult. I had to stand off to one side for fear of the rapid change in temperature which was difficult to do since it was a small shower stall. The toilet in our room was plugged but was taken care of immediately. Thanks. The room was a bit small especially the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice.”
Reviews.Author: buttercup87
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget choice for Vancouver. Rooms are clean and many include a fridge and microwave. The inner flower garden is a lovely little oasis away from the dirt and noise of the city. Breakfast is included. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “room is tiny but overall stay was good”
Reviews.Author: Crystal070
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little iffy staying here, I am a chambermaid myself and when we checked in I had checked the mattress and everything and it was really clean; although the room was VERY tiny (exspecially the bathroom) and did have a funny smell; other then that the front desk was nice and the room was affordable; and close to everything you need. i,e resturarnts; liquor store; waterpark; mcdonalds; gas station; metrotown mall;

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: golouis99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 3 nights in July 2011. Paid $90 per night. The room was more than large enough for a couple with the added bonus of a mini-fridge and coffee maker. We were on the second floor and there is no elevator so we had to haul our bags up 2 flights of stairs from the carpark. The continental breakfast was basic with milk and coffee running out and only one staff person struggling to keep up with demand. Also the breakfast room was crowded so we had to wait for a table - perhaps we should have got up an hour earlier to beat the rush! In fairness it should be stated that the hotel was full when we were there. The hotel is located 20 minutes drive to the downtown tourist attractions but travelling time is offset by the lower room prices - so that made it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: claudia_canes
Reviews.Content: I came in from Portland and really enjoyed my stay. The inner courtyard provided a peaceful sanctuary, and the bed was super comfortable. The location was central enough, the staff friendly, and the continental breakfast that was included was just a great added bonus! I'll definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: PugetSoundMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. It is clear they are remodeling, starting on the outside, which is nice. The people who work there were all very nice and the room was clean which is important BUT it's located in a weird location (you have to park in back and walk around to the front facing the street to conduct business with the front desk), the bathroom is TINY ( I hit my leg while using the toilet on the vanity - yes it is that close) and the continental breakfast is a waste of time. I usually pick a hotel based on having a continental breakfast but all they had was toast, bagels and cereal. The fruit was not good and they were out of coffee both mornings. Not a bad place for the price I guess but I won't be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Good value,basic,economical”
Reviews.Author: bratcliffe1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a good stay for the money, it was clean and comfortable and quiet. The room was small but ample. The parking was convenient and free. It was fine for an economical overnight business trip or similar.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: mazianne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if your on a budget & want the essentials i.e bed & shower.Our room was spotless & a few minutes after we checked in the receptionist called to ask if everything was satisfactory.We didn't have to deal with anyone so can't really comment on the service, we just got up had breakfast & went back to our room. The location is easily accessible via sky train / bus.We did a search on the cheapest hotels as we are backpackers on a budget & found this one to be the best deal even though it only includes continental breakfast.(most hotels don't include this) Two things I will say about this hotel as a con is the Breakfast & noise.Eating cereal out of paper bowls is just wrong! Breakfast comprised of variations of bread, cereal, tea / coffee & a limited selection of fruit.You can hear people walking around be it outside or inside regularly, the walls are paper thin! At the end of the day you pay for what you get so no point in moaning about little things if your not willing to pay extra! I would recommend this to the penny pincher!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was provocative and different.”
Reviews.Author: Gaylloyd
Reviews.Content: The room and location was quiet with a pleasing ambiance. All bussinesses that deal with people are really social expierance. The service from the staff at the front desk wasn't that great because they did not offer delt descriptions of benefits available to Days Inn's guest. The best thing I liked best is that Mr. Charles Rent, the manager was extreamly considerate, listened well and did his best to address our many concerns. I also liked that the resturant accross the street, Tipper and the hotel seem to have an agreement where gest receive a 10% discount when dinning there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pippi90
Reviews.Content: Great super clean hotel ! Spend there a couple days and liked it a lot. It is close to downtown Vancouver. The rooms are clean - pretty new and comfi. The bathroom was clean too - so thats a good thing =) The price for the rooms are great too. The breakfast is alright - not to much of a choice if you stay for a longer time but alright I suppose. Would stay at this hotel any time again if I would come back. Is the best place one could find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Friendly Staff - Decent Included Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Victoriabound
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while I was in town visiting my daughter. Her apt was close by and the Days Inn was a very convenient location. I just needed a comfortable place to rest for the night. I walked in without a reservation and Celene at the front desk reception was very efficient in checking me in. Rate: The rate was $59 for the night before tax. Included Continental Breakfast: It ran for a decent time from 7 until 9:30am I had no idea that breakfast was included until Celene told me as she was handing me the room key. It was a nice perk. The breakfast room is located down stairs from the main reception area. Has approx 12 small tables and seats for about 25. A few different types of cereals, some whole grain and white bagels, white and brown breads and a few choices of small pastries (tiny muffins and 3" fruit danish) just the right size. Of course there was coffee/ tea / apple and orange juices. There was also an array of newspapers available on a side table. Internet: There is complementary wifi and they provide the password OR for a minimal fee you can use their computer in the main lobby. I was told by the morning reception it was $4 for 15 minutes. Rooms: Comfortable room, with a firm bed. Contemporary decor newly decorated. The pillows were very comfortable. Clean carpet. Bathroom was small and dated with white tiles but adequate. Shower stall only - no bath but that worked for me for this trip. The building is secure with access only through the main lobby or at the sides with room key access only. It is on a very busy stretch of Kingsway and we had a room close to the main road. With the windows closed the noise from the road was not a problem. But the noise from the stairs inside the building was a bit bothersome. Next time we stay I would definitely ask for a room that is not directly beside the stairs. The hotel has lots of rooms at the back away from the roadway in a residential area. Other than the stair noise that ALL the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and positive. The picture I attached is taken of the interior courtyard. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a cheap place to sleep. Also, the television was decent in my room.”
Reviews.Author: Boomboy007
Reviews.Content: The best thing that I can say is that it was a very cheap rate for a relatively clean room. The room that I had was fairly large, but had a tiny bathroom. Why they refurbished it with a lot of wasted space in the main room while scrimping on the bathroom, I'll never understand. That said, I paid about $50 a night, and that suited me just fine. The location is very interesting, despite the occasional professional lady making her obvious rounds. I mean, this IS a liberal area of a liberal city, and I saw the same thing in other areas. The main road on which it is located has some FANTASTIC restaurants along its length, from fantastic Pho to incredible Indian. The proliferation of restaurants catering to many different types of Asian foods has to be seen to be believed. There is even a groovy Bollywood style theater with a balcony that shows Indian movies WITH English subtitles! That said, I found the service to be somewhat lackadaisical. As I was meeting my girlfriend there, and she was going to arrive first, I asked the main reservations office for Days Inn to make a note requesting that she be allowed to check in upon her arrival (the reservation was pre-paid in order to get the good rate). I also called the hotel directly and spoke with the desk person to ensure that there was no problem with her earlier check-in. Upon her arrival, of course, NO RECORD of my request. I had to pull over on I-5 and call the hotel directly. They finally acquiesced, but gave us one of the least desirable rooms at the front (noisy side) of the hotel. Also, one BIG ISSUE that I have is that, after the first day, they charged my card with a $50 deposit for damages and incidentals WITHOUT MY KNOWLEDGE OR AUTHORIZATION. Now, I really don't see the point, considering the fact that no other hotel in which I have stayed has ever charged me a deposit in case of "damage and incidentals" (there was no mini-bar, so I am not sure what incidentals they meant). However, to charge my card, even a measly $50, without my authorization is simply not acceptable business practice. When I complained at the desk, the lady kept explaining that it was simply a deposit that would be refunded. I let her know that I understood the concept of a deposit, but the point was that no one had informed me of the charge. She simply kept repeating her explanation of a deposit, without addressing my actual concern. The deposit was NOT included in my pre-payment to Hotels.com. It has now been four business days since my check-out, and the payment has yet to be refunded. This (illegal) practice has really tarnished what would have been a thumbs up referral for my fellow cheap travelers.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy and unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: lawnna00
Reviews.Content: My husband has MS among other health issues. A road trip for him is too long, so we have to stay at a hotel near UBC. The room was nice for 30 seconds, until we noticed all the bad things. The stay was not only with the dirty room but it was way too noisy and the morning receptionist did not care about what we told her when she asked how our stay was. They don't live up to their suppose "customer promise".

Reviews.Title: “Good value - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: chrisKelowna_BC
Reviews.Content: We go to Vancouver frequently to visit family that we can't stay with. This was the first time we've stayed at the Days Inn on Kingsway. The price was right and we decided to take a chance, despite some of the bad reviews. We were not unhappy with the hotel. It is older and could use some sprucing up. The room was clean but a yucky carpet. No bath, a shower in a smaller bathroom. The linens were fine and breakfast is included. The breakfast was cereals, toast, bagels, juice, coffee, some fresh fruit, and pastries. Not bad at all. No elevator and we faced the McDonald's next door. Reasonably quiet at night. We'll probably be back. Free high speed wireless internet included and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service and Experience in my life! NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: bebe_escape
Reviews.Content: Well this is going to be a long review. We booked online originally for one day (A Sat) then decided to do two days a Friday and a Saturday. Well we first called the hotel they were saying we couldn't add another day to get their special, then they said we couldn't cancel and rebook either as our reservation wasn't refundable. So we called the guest services on their website, the lady was very nice and worked out a deal for us so we could still get our two nights at the hotel, so we thought. We show up at the hotel on Friday to find out we are only booked in for one day instead of the two we had booked over the phone. Somehow this non-refundable Saturday night was canceled and refunded. We stood there arguing with the hotel manager and the two staff members for over an hour, they wouldn't help us at all. Apparently they were sold out, I then asked their manager to contact their guest services to correct this situation as we had booked for two nights. We spent another hour or so over the phone and all that they kept repeating to us, was that we only had booked for one night as per their computer. Which is fine, if that was correct. We had booked for two nights and the manager or guest services refused any further help. I asked the situation to be escalated further to the guest service manager. At which point the hotel manager said they had two rooms available now (in the last 2 hours they somehow found an extra room here n there) which he then said we could book it for $119 instead of the $89 we were advised over the phone. Not only did he not price match what we were guaranteed, he then pretended like he was busy through out this whole ordeal in his office (which btw the blinds were not close and he was not busy at all sitting there looking outside of the door). Long story short, this was the worst experience as far as customer service goes. The manager should of honored the price that we were advised over the phone as this was the agents fault at Days Inn office, just because he wanted to make more money on someone else booking it. His values were wrong, instead of insuring the clients are happy with this HUGE dilemma that they have caused us, he saw an opportunity to make more money. It was disgusting, the lack of care he had towards the situation, he did not even apologize in reference to the situation. He then just walked out of the office and left his two poor staff members to deal with the situation, way to show team effort and lead by example boss! Now lets get to the fun part, we walk into the room. It was dirty, the bathroom needed to be cleaned and yeah the guest attendant that was left there felt bad for the situation and at least he said sorry about the whole mix up. I think he should be the manager and not the other guy. The breakfast was nothing but a few 2 inch long muffins and juice and toasted bread/bagel. Nothing fancy. We did finally get a call back from the manager at the Guest Service Office, in which I told her my concerns and she said that we should book the $119 and that they would refund us the difference because the manager didnt want to do it so guest services offered to do that for us.. except by this time we had booked a night for $86.00 at Travel Lodge in North Vancouver (close to downtown even more than this other location) WHICH by the way, highly recommend it. Clean bathrooms, sheets and fantastic service. Overall I will never EVER book with Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Jewel”
Reviews.Author: canadatripper2010
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be an all-round good experience. The hotel is outside the busy downtown, but not all that far to drive to and is right on a bus line if you wanted to use it. It was clean and comfortable and had a beautifully landscaped and maintained courtyard. The continental breakfast room was fine. What was really convenient for us across the street was the laundramat, since we traveled in a Corvette and were limited on luggage, and the Tipper Restaurant had friendly folks who gave us tips on directions and travel as well as a good meal. The hotel staff was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Courtyard Garden”
Reviews.Author: KatherineNoel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in Chinatown with warnings everywhere about locking up your valuables and Days Inn not being responsible for things stolen. We had no problem with theft the 2 nights that we were there. There is a laundromat right across the street, and also an excellent restaurant called the Bottle Tipper. The room was clean and the garden was beautifully manicured. Check in and out was very quick and easy. I had to pay $4 for a card to use the internet. Cheap rooms and not a very long drive to downtown. Breakfast was decent but very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Charge what they want no matter what.....”
Reviews.Author: Curt67
Reviews.Content: I booked with Wyndham. It was a prepaid rate with no possibilty of cancellation no matter what. Fine..... I had my confirmation number with a grand total of x. Got my credit card statement 2 month before my stay. They charged me slithgly more than they should of. I sent them an email asking for an explanation. They didn't even bother answer me. Give them your credit card and they will charge you the rate they want no matter the rate you agreed on...... I stayed in hundreds of hotels in my life and it's the first time i have a problem like this. I paid it but I will never come back. Rip-off.......

Reviews.Title: “I booked 14 days in advance so rate was...”
Reviews.Author: cheeks71
Reviews.Content: I booked 14 days in advance so rate was great. Neighbourhood wasn't "that bad"!! I saw one prostitute in two days. The rooms were cozy, beds and pillows comfy. The restaurant across the street has great food(menu in rooms don't recall the name). The gentleman at the front desk was very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Unnaceptable”
Reviews.Author: ado87
Reviews.Content: Prostitution in the area of the hotel. They told me is uncontrollable and happend in any place. But I was around the city and it did not happened in other areas. They did not return your money if you already booked and I preferred to lost my money and find a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DGirl29
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant staying here after reading some of the reviews, but I really don't know where the negative reviews come from! When we checked in, it was quick and staff was very friendly. Room wasn't huge and I will admit the bathroom was small- and my first impression of the room was that it was going to be noisy because it was right off of the stairwell and facing the street. However, that was not the case at all. I slept great all the nights I was there and the bed was sooo comfy. Plus, great pillows. It really didn't matter that the room or bathroom wasn't big- we were more than comfortable. Continental breakfast was, well, what you'd expect in any place. People crowded around the toaster and just the array of bagels, bread and cereal you get with any continental fare. Try breakfast across the street at The TIpper- really good! Or, save your money and have some toast and cereal :) Was a nice 10-15 walk to Nanaimo station and from there it's easy to get anywhere in Vancouver. We loved this walk too after a long day where we enjoyed too much good food :) Even a Blockbuster a block away to buy some cheap dvds and bring back to the hotel to play in your laptop if you want to relax in the room after a long day. No complaints from me, my husband or our two friends that also stayed at the Days Inn Metro. If/When we're back in Vancouver we will stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: mori52
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Friday afternoon and did not have to wait in the lobby, we had no problem with being 3 hours early and check in was smooth and helpful. The desk was able to help with directions and recommendations for dining, walking, sky train etc. Room had two queen beds and a small but efficient bathroom with a great shower. There was also a small fridge and a coffee machine. Extra towels were easy to get. Close to downtown, about a 10 minute drive. Lots of ammeneties close-by. 24 hour Macdonalds next door, great restaurant across the street (Tippers) that would bring over room service and bill to the room. Major banks right across the street as well as a major Mall & Theatre nearby. Great parking right outside the rooms. Airy outdoor atria right outside all rooms. Really easy access to all rooms as well. Typical continental breakfast. Great value, we stayed for three nights and the total cost was only $308 CDN booked through Expedia and saved quite a few $$'s. We were there for a Marathon and compared to the Host Hotel we saved over $350.00 and had much easier access to everything. I would highly recommend this Days Inn. Oh yea, if you like Vietnamese food you will be in Heaven here! Lots of Pho houses nearby and really safe environment. Really nice front desk staff, a change from the hurry up 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: amirna57
Reviews.Content: This hotel offer the best service in its category and around the same area. It's the ultimate destination for people looking for tideness and affordable room rate combined. Very good value for money. You will never be disappointed. I recommend it highly for business and/or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Family Visit”
Reviews.Author: KCSantaClara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Days Inn Vancouver Metro from Jan 28 to Feb 1 to visit family. I chose this hotel for its close proximity to my family. I rented a car and used the hotel mainly to sleep. I had a top floor non smoking unit towards the back. The front desk was responsive, efficient, but not overly friendly that was okay for me. The room had a fridge and coffee maker (I did not use them) but not a microwave (I did not need one). The room was clean but on the small side. The internet access worked fine. The breakfast was basic, but sufficient and convenient. I like the fact that it is available until 10 am, while many other hotels offer their complimentary breakfast to only 9 am. I like the complimentary parking and had no problem finding space anytime. The bathroom was small but functional. I did not feel unsafe in the room. I saw workers continuously cleaning the garden and public areas, which is a good sign. Maybe preparing for the Winter Olympic had something to do with it. I have stayed at newer hotels and hotels with more amenities in prior visits to Vancouver, but their locations are further from my family's place and I paid alot more for them as well. Overall, my stay at this hotel served my purpose and offered good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: travelMonki
Reviews.Content: This motel / hotel had an overshadowing sense of 'cheap'. Some examples - The rooms were advertised as non-smoking however there was a distinct odour of smoke, on-top of which was more odour which was likely used to disguise the original cigarette smoke. There were burn marks from cigarettes on the quilt cover. A very simple breakfast was provided, however the cereal dispenser would crush it as it dispensed and turn most of the flakes into powder. Service was fine overall. The location is questionable, so beware: if you drive here, do not leave your valuables in the car even if it's in the carpark overnight. Secure all of your valuables in your room or bring them with you if you go out as this is NOT a safe neighbourhood. I acknowledge that the hotel is not responsible for the following, but noteworthy for future travellers; - I opened the window to let some air in the room and saw a man taking a leak right outside our window in the motel carpark. - Late at night a man walked through the courtyard (which is supposed to be accessible to guests only) screaming "housekeeping" in an imitation feminine voice. Funny in hindsight - not so at the time. - We've read other reviews on Trip Advisor which have warned of bed bugs and car theft.

Reviews.Title: “a great place with a car”
Reviews.Author: paulanddavid
Reviews.Content: This place was great for us. It would not be good if you didn't have a car. The place is clean and a good value for the money. It's only 15 minutes to downtown. Also there are some restaurants across the street give a discount when you show your room key. The staff was great. We couldn't find the remote control. We called the front desk and within 15 minutes they brought us a replacement. I am sorry for the prior reviewer who complained about having their car broken into. However, there are huge signs posted in the parking lot about not leaving valuables in your car.

Reviews.Title: “cigarettes and bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: traveller9947
Reviews.Content: A 'no smoking' sign on the door made me happy...until i opened it and smelled the reek of cigarettes that had permeated through the door cracks from the ash tray less than a few meters from our door. I asked them to remove it, but that didn't remove the stench that was obviously going to remain from all the people smoking right outside that door. Then...then to crawl into bed and find something else crawling in my bed...bed bugs...that was when we left and will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It damages the good reputation of the Days Inn Name”
Reviews.Author: PW72
Reviews.Content: Both rooms had a bad smell and so did the bedding. The bedding was old and worn, the pillows.beds lumpy and uncomfortable. You had to manouver onto the toilet to be sure you didnt get hurt by the sharp protruding sink top. There was no inclusive breakfast as advertised, they offered you to go to MacDonalds, there was no lift or help with all our bags, no microwave or fridge. The car park was small and full. We did not get one of the rooms we had reserved. It was noisy, overall appearance dirty and the area was unsafe and looked like a slum. I would advise folk to stay away from this place for their own comfort and security. We have stayed in many Days Inns in the US and Canada and were on a tour of BC. This was the absolute worst we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for 1 night or 2 at a push”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBritUK
Reviews.Content: I would not reccommend that you stay any longer than 1 night but if you must no longer than 2, this is a place that is ok to get your head down for a night and thats it. Plus points: Great shower - very powerful and plenty of room. Room was resonably clean. Good location on Kingsway with number #19 transit bus running right outside and this takes you downtown and to Stanley Park.....make sure you have the correct change for buses its $2.50 for zone 1, you keep the ticket and its good for 1.5 hour anywhere in zone 1. Desk clerk in the morning called a taxi for me, very helpful. OK selection of breakfast items - nothing fancy but enough to fill you up. Fair price for basic bed and breakfast. Minus points: Front desk in the evening were not very helpful, i checked in at around 18:30 and had to struggle up the stairs with 3 suitcases whilst the desk clerk watched! and then i had to struggle along to the room right down the bottom corridoor....thankfully i was not placed upstairs so thanks so much for the help there staff. At 2am on one of the mornings some of the guests staying were having an argument, this continued until 4am when they had obviously burned themselves out.....i was thinking that maybe the night desk clerk was asleep because these guests were running freely up and down the complex, slamming doors at each other that could have been heard by someone standing in Stanley Park, I know its not the hotel's fault that guests were arguing but it is their responsibility to be looking out on the complex at night and resolve any such issues, it was not just myself that had to listen to it, several people at breakfast were also complaining about it. Very drab and depressing room decor and in desperate need of an upgrade with some fresh, lighter colours. I was travelling alone and i did not feel safe in the room at all.....the door had a gap when locked that you could push your finger into. The telepone crackled really badly whilst on the line. The wireless internet is not on a secure network. The desk clerk in the morning along with a manager watched whilst i again struggled out the door and down the stairs with 3 suitcases....thanks. As someone has previously mentioned this place is not wheelchair friendly.....or suitcase wheeling friendly.....strange for a hotel right? Whilst i was waiting in the lobby i heard another guest arguing with the staff about the fact that they had requested by email to stay another night at short notice and that they had agreed a rate, the staff would not honour it and were not taking any reponsibility.....yes i did not know the full story and these guests could have been trying to pull a fast one but i noticed that one of the other reviewers on here had also had some problem with rates etc over email so i put this in to make people aware.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Communication!!!”
Reviews.Author: rlacjack
Reviews.Content: Although we arrived well before check in, the staff did allow us to leave our luggage at the front desk. We had booked two smoking rooms with Queen Beds for two ngihts. We were traveling with two grown children (23 and 24 years old). Check in was at 3:00 pm. When we arrived at 4:00 pm we were told that our rooms were ready and to proceed, but we could not have the two smoking rooms as promised. Not really a problem as we could go out onto the balcony / garden area to smoke. We arrived at our rooms to find one completely not even started by the chambermaid and the other was about half way done. There was about another 1/2 hr wait. The next afternoon when we cam back after sightseeing, the tv was not working. We inquired at the front desk to be told that a complaint would be issued, they were not TV repairmen! My husband finally discovered after crawling the perimeter of the room, that the cord was unplugged. Showers very clean but small and no bathtubs! Cleanliness was ok, but staff said they were misinformed of all our request by the website we used. I just don't buy it as upon arrival everything was confirmed! The continental breakfast was stale and many people were complaining about it. If you just need a bed for the night..go for it, as for the rest...stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Unsecure Parking Lot”
Reviews.Author: 47Traveler_9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Days Inn Vancouver Metro until our car was broken into as we were checking out at 8:00 AM. The parking lot has access from a local street and has no fences or barriers to prevent entry from theives. The Motel has a sign in the lot and cameras, but no recording device to allow any follow up investigation. The staff were polite but did little more than dial the local police for us and provide a piece of cardboard for our broken window. We will no longer trust Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - all mod cons”
Reviews.Author: Brettyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely; I can't imagine why people are slating it. The staff are friendly and rooms have refrigerators and microwaves. Not much nearby but buses pass the hotel frequently to downtown. Also about 10 blocks left of the hotel is a lovely restaurant called Bino's which opens late.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: inazer
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Expedia and it was not cheap. I stayed with my wife and 2 years old son. The room looked very depressing in colors, furniture and window coverings. The bed sheets looked old and worn out and mattress springs were uncomfortable. We could not sleep for two nights because our room was facing the main road and it was too noisy. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience in my holiday.”
Reviews.Author: the_berz
Reviews.Content: I make a reservation for three night on internet. The web was not clear and they take my money in advance. The room that they reserved to us was on the main street with a dirty carpet. When we open the sofa under this there was a lot of peanuts and other food not definible. The bed linen was dirty and with a lot of hole. The receptionist come to us and clean and change the linen. When we try to sleep, the sofa was broken and we can't sleep all night. The other days they change our room with one cleaner then the previous room, but the bed linen are with a lot of hole also in this last room. Incredible!!! They refund only the price of the extra bed for my son.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThaisZundt
Reviews.Content: I really liked Days Inn Vancouver, The location and rooms are so good, so is the breakfast. All the clerks were very kind and helpful with us. Rooms and beds so comfortable. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kuchers
Reviews.Content: Parking lots are limited so do not move your car at night if you want to park close to the hotel. No breakfast, but there are plans to offer one. McDonalds is next door, but some strange people hang out there. The room was ok, almost clean, a little noisy because of the street, but ok to sleep and relax. Got around perfectly by car, Metrotown is not too far away and a good place to spend the night. Lots of Asian food around so prepare for driving when looking for something else. Staff was helpful and there was no problem in extanding our stay when our flight got cancelled. But some renovation would be nice. The patio was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: bitride
Reviews.Content: The price wasn't too bad booking through a 3rd party service. The room was ok, but on the lower end of average. No major issues though. Due to stairs and doors in-between the parking lot and the rooms, luggage was a pain. No on-site restaurant or even continental breakfast, just a couple of vending machines, but a McDonalds next door was sufficient for the morning. Not much noise, and no complaints about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality for high price”
Reviews.Author: mbsimjam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place with 4 people in our group. Got a room with a pull out couch. The mattress was unbearable and we ended up having to sleep on the floor!! complained and the extremely unfriendly person at the front desk gave us a token 10% off and was not pleased about having to do so. Finally got in contact with the manager and was a bit more understanding. But overall the experience was not good at all. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: prairielover
Reviews.Content: I have had good experiences with Days Inns elsewhere in the country, which is the reason I booked here. I was attending a conference in Vancouver and was forced to spend 4 nights at the hotel. I couldn't change hotels - nothing available within a two-hour bus ride to the conference venue for a price my employer would pay. I felt the hotel was misrepresented on the website - amenities and services were promised and not delivered. Negatives: Sleeping area - tiny and crowded. Bathroom - cramped with absolutely no heat unless the door to the sleeping area is left open. The vanity is about 3 inches from the toilet. Cleanliness - my travelling partner had an infestation of ants in the room. Closets - small point but annoying - few hangers and many of these were broken. Food and beverage service - nothing. Website advertises tea and coffee in lobby - nothing there. Website advertises many restaurants within walking distance - all Asian. Walking distance must mean something else in Vancouver -- the closest White Spot was over a mile away. But there is a McDonalds next door if you like fast food for breakfast, and if you ask nicely, the front desk clerk will give a coupon for a whopping $4.00. Front desk - one clerk very helpful, the rest condescending and patronizing. Travel - expensive cab rides from any attractions Postives: Cost - good value for Vancouver Noise - rooms were remarkably quiet Courtyard - there is a beautiful courtyard filled with flowers and shrubs. Someone looks after the gardens with love. Travel - good bus service to most attractions Will I stay there again? No. Will I suggest anyone else stay there? No.

Reviews.Title: “great deal for low budget travel”
Reviews.Author: minimiii
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in Days Inn metro right now. I'm a university sudent coming from toronto with my bf between the term break. We are staying for a week in a Queen bed smoking room. As we are students, our budget are so limited, We found a great deal from days inn metro online(about $60 a night), which is really good deal. The room is a bit small, but overall it's clean and tidy. The frontdesk is very nice - when we first arrived, we sorta asked for where to go, she kindly gave us some tips on where to go, and gave us a whole bunch of brochures and directions for attractions. As we rented a car, going anywhere is just so convenient . And it's so easy to find the way back to the hotel(so far, we didn't get lost ...yet). About 10mins drive to metrotown, 15mins to Robson st, 15mins to stanley park.... although we choose to stay in a smoking room, i didn't expect to get such a strong tobacco smell in the room. I hope they could improve on this(because many other hotels smoking room won't smell that strong, so I believe there are ways to improve).

Reviews.Title: “not so nice”
Reviews.Author: otter1963
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overall OK and cheap but we had some problems. The coffee machine in the room was durty and in both rooms there were a strong unpleasant smell of some chemicals that they must have used for cleaning. Despite of what they say in their website it takes you at least 40 minutes by bus to go downtown. My children bought a nice stuffed otter at the wonderful Vancouver Aquarium. They forgot it in the room (100%sure) I called them asking to mail it back to me in Wisconsin (offering to pay for it) but they said they did not find it. Not a big deal: I bought a new one at the aquarium website and I told the children it was the same one. I just think it was really unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worse of the worse”
Reviews.Author: Trione
Reviews.Content: Tried to make a reservation on line with BCAA and could not get a confirmation. Phoned the property and talked to an obnoxious person who gave me a price much higher than the BCAA price. When I asked to talk to the Manager, I was put on hold several times with the excuse that the Manager was busy. After some time it became obvious I was never going to be connected to the Manager. I wrote the parent company who passed me back to a desk Manager who ended up giving me a discount to stay there. My stay was one of the worst. Old run down room with pipes banging and yelling in the night. The stairways were blocked with house keeping carts and it was next to impossible to get by them to the room. When I inquired about another date, I was given a price them shortly after, she (Desk Manager) told me the price was going to be higher because they were busy. Over all, the staff suck, the rooms are old & run down and I would not recommend it to anyone unless you can't find a room at the "Y".

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Days Inn Vancouver Metro”
Reviews.Author: vitale1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was on vacation in Vancouver. The hotel is very convenient to all tourist attractions. The rooms are small but very clean and cozy. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Old and Stuffy.”
Reviews.Author: soosie61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right on Kingsway in Vancouver. HOWEVER, the area is very loud and goes 24 hours a day with the traffic, sirens, honking, etc. The rooms are old and not well ventilated. Our air conditioning unit fell apart when we tried to use it. It actually fell off the wall. And of course, opening the window was not an option due to the noise factor. As well our washroom and shower had silver fish crawling across the tile floors. I honestly believe this is a $39.95 / night motel, it is certainly not worth the $100 / night we paid for the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lost_travelers
Reviews.Content: We checked into our non-smoking room with a queen bed after traveling 15+ hours from the states. Once our luggage was organized, our room keys stopped working. The front desk told us this was an ongoing problem and gave us new keys which also did not work. She told us management would be in at midnight and "might be able to fix it, and might not." Not much of a guarantee. The only other queen room available was smoking which was definately not an option for us. Since we didn't want to wait til midnight for maintenance we were put into a room with 2 beds and a smaller TV. We were assured we would not be charged for the more expensive room. We asked if we could be put into a AAA member room because it was available with a queen bed, they told us we would be charged for that accomodation. If we booked well in advance and our broken key entry on the door was the hotel's fault, shouldn't they accomodate us to another room with the same or more specifications than we asked and not a downgrade? Also, if they were being so kind as to not charge us for the 2 bed room, shouldn't they be so kind and not charge us for the member room? On observation of the hotel parking lot, there are less than 20 cars. I guess they are all staying in a queen room! I saw a previous complaint was replied to by Randy, unfortunately he doesn't work here anymore. I'm hoping Veshna and/or Bill will find this review and allow their employees to better accomodate their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: GGS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this quaint inn for three nights when attending a conference at BC Place. It is a gorgeous property with beautiful landscaping at the curb & especially in the enclosed courtyard. The room was in excellent condition & spotlessly clean. Very nice décor & comfortable bed. All rooms overlook the enclosed courtyard & make you feel almost like being in an exotic garden. The courtesy call from the front desk shortly after check-in was a nice touch which shows they care. All staff were friendly & helpful with directions & suggestions on places to dine. It only took about ten minutes to drive to downtown or Metro Town even between 7:30 & 8:00 a.m. A wonderful experience & great value. I would definite recommend this Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs??”
Reviews.Author: silverhorse1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and enjoyed my stays. However, this time, my husband was bitten by something (bed bugs is my guess). I was not staying overnight there as I was caring for a sick relative in hospital. This makes me wonder if I want to stay there again. Quite gross.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: girluncensored
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a travel voucher from a promotional company. It was decently clean but it was in a run-down and pretty scary part of town. The mini fridge didn't work in our room so we had to keep our food in ice. I didn't mind the McDonald's vouchers, it was better than most 'continental' breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable for a Quick Stopover”
Reviews.Author: cosette13
Reviews.Content: We do not live too far from Vancouver, but needed to be downtown at 7am and I did not want to fight traffic. Its high season and cruise ship season in Vancouver right now, so getting a hotel under $175 is hard to find. I had stayed at this motel back in 2001 for one night and remembered it was clean. That is all I needed for one night. I paid $93 plus taxes on a AAA rate. This motel is definately only worth about $49 anywhere else in the world, but this is Vancouver during cruise season! Parking is down the side and back of the motel and you walk around to the front. There are a few stairs to the check in desk. There are NO ramps and it is not wheelchair accessible at ALL. Keep this in mind if this is something you need. The lady at check in, Rashma, did not crack a smile the whole time. She was the most miserable person I have ever encountered working at a motel. She wasn't rude or anything to us, but seemed to have very little patience for questions and just seemed stressed or something. I had requested a ground floor room with 2 beds. We had this no problem. I strongly suggest you request ground floor rooms. Some rooms are 'underground' - you take stairs down to them and some rooms are up a level on the 2nd floor. Even to get to the ground floor rooms you have to go down about 5 stairs. Not a big deal for us, but for wheelchair people this is not happening - this place is not wheelchair friendly at all. The room was small, but adequate. Beds were extremely comfortable and there were 3 huge fluffy pillows on each bed. So this was very good! Desk with chair and free wireless (but its sloooooooow). Coffee pot in the room. The really odd thing was the size of the bathroom - it was soooooooo tiny that when you use the toilet you are crammed in a corner between the walk and the edge of the sink. There was a shower stall, no tub. Our room was very quiet. No noise issues at all. A very funny thing was the 'pay movies' advertised on the website. On top of the tv is this old old movie box. On one of the channels you had your choice. If you press button 1 on top of the box you can get Big Daddy and some other movie from back in the mid-ninties for 4.95 or if you press button 2 you get 2 porn movies for 5.95. Interesting in room movie selection. They do have full cable with all the channels. At night, I decided to get the coffee pot ready for the next morning so I could just flick it on. I pulled the glass carafe out and it was broken! Someone must have broken it and put it back carefully - I pulled it out and a huge piece of glass fell off and just missed my foot! I called the front desk to tell them and the girl working seemed pretty indifferent about it. I asked for another pot and she said they were in storage and it was too dark to go in there. I told her there was glass all over the floor and she said "oh I will make a note of it for housekeeping tomorrow". HUH? I put a towel down there so I didn't walk on it at all. Also, note that the vending machine is a little off. My daughter put in $1.25 for reeses pb cups and she got a hershey's almond bar. She doesnt like those, so I put in another $1.25 and she pushed the button for some chips, and out came the reeses cups. At this point we were laughing and wanted to see what happened next, so I put in $1.25 for a hersheys bar, and out popped chips! So its a mystery and be prepared to eat whatever happens to come out! The next morning I was checking out early and Rashma was on the desk. Oh joy! She still had the miserable look on her face from the day before. She was on the phone with someone making a reservation and I couldnt believe what I heard! She said to the person "Listen you are going to have to hurry up I have guests checking out and its very busy for me!". Then she read back their reservation and asked for a credit card. I guess the person said they had to go get it. She says to them FIRMLY "When calling to make a reservation you need to have this information handy when you call. I am very busy and have people checking out and really don't have time for this! Why could you not call in the afternoon like most people? Is there a reason you are making a reservation early in the morning? I am very busy!". OMG! If someone did that to me I would have hung up and called the days inn head office! I was shocked. She then got the info and hung up and rolled her eyes at the phone. I just smiled and signed my bill. She only gave us our McD's breakfast vouchers after I asked. I would stay here again in a pinch if I needed ONE night. I couldn't stay here for more than one night due to the squished in toilet alone. But its a good clean stopover motel. Just don't expect a smile at the front desk and be prepared to eat at McDs or drive up the street for something else. It is about a 10 min drive into downtown, or a 10-15 min drive to Metrotown mall.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: Inuk_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with the service of the front staff. After check in my friend and I had to wait about 10 minutes before we got keys that didn't work, while the front desk clerk served 2 other people. During one evening my friend and I were waiting for a taxi cab and after 30 minutes I asked the front desk guy to call another company and he refused...after 40 minutes a car pulled up and a very drunk man solicited us for services we were not willing to give. After repeatedly saying no to the man we ignored him. He then parked his vehicle and started walking toward us and yelling. We then went back to the front desk and told the staff (one staff member) working that there was a man outside who wouldn't leave us alone. The hotel clerk looked out the window and went 'huh'. The drunk guy came into the hotel and was belligerent and rude to us and the front desk clerk DID NOTHING. They say they offer coupons for the McDonald's next door but we didn't receive any until we asked. The rooms were okay but not great and this hotel is NOT wheelchair accessible in any way. Once again, the front desk staff were very unhelpful and not courteous

Reviews.Title: “"Satisfactiion guaranteed or you do not pay" ad is a lie !”
Reviews.Author: hotel_critiquer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we needed internet access and they advertised that they had free internet in each room. We got there to find that it was not available in certain rooms including ours, and that since they were fully booked, they could not give us a room with internet access. Second problem. It was a cold night, so we turned on the heater in the middle of the night. It caused a burning smell and it set off an ear-deafening fire alarm. We had to air out the room and sleep in the cold. SO... since there was a card in the room saying "if you are not completely satisfied with your stay and we cannot make it right, you do not pay for that portion of your stay," we again mentioned the issues upon checkout. They tried to make us pay the full charge for the room anyway, so we showed them their own printed guarantee, upon which they reluctantly gave us a discount of $5.

Reviews.Title: “free continental breakfast , Eh!”
Reviews.Author: omolmed
Reviews.Content: First of all, I really felt that I paid more than the place should cost! Furthermore, there was nothing continental about their free breakfast because all it was is a voucher that can cover one cup of coffee and one muffin. Also the room was really cold, and I mean it! When I complained about the heat in the room, all they did was to tell me that they turn off the heater at night! Also, I had a serious jet lag problem and I don't know why do their garden birds only sing at a particular hour! Overall, I will not return to this place when I will come back to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible cusomter service! - do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: daysInnVancouverNo
Reviews.Content: I decided to visit Canada with my parents and my girlfriend. We booked two non-smoking rooms in the Days Inn ( adress) in Vancouver, BC, Canada. When we checked in , we discovered the rooms stunk like cigarette smoke! We were very surprised because we had selected ‘non-smoking’ on web site we used for our reservation. We walked back to the reception desk and explained the situation to the person on shift. The gentlemen, named Ron, explained that there was nothing he could do. Apparently to him, no apology was necessary. He let us know that they were completely booked and that he really was not able to be of any further assistance. His attitude and rudeness were shocking. We requested to talk to the manager so he called him and spoke with him on the phone. After he hung up, he said that there was nothing left to be done, that we were free to check out and that we would not be charged. I asked him about this TWICE to confirm his statement. So, in light of not wanting to spend the night in an unpleasantly smelling room- we left, however, the real motivation for us to leave was mainly because of the way this man had the audacity to speak to us- his customers After returning to Portland , my girlfriend realized that there was a charge on her credit card for one night in both rooms. She called the hotel and the staff told her that Ron had made a note in the computer that we were informed that we were going to be charged for the night. We tried to talk to the manager again, but he told us that we didn’t have any proof of what we were previously told. He said, and I quote, “ I am not going to let you not pay for these rooms”. He said that there is a late cancellation fee that we were required to pay. I agreed that I was aware of this fee but that the issue had to do with Ron lying to us, then going out of his way to make a note in the computer that he had told us otherwise. I made a claim with the Days Inn customer service a few days ago. I called back today for a follow up. The manager of this hotel told them that we selected smoking rooms because they were cheaper. That was another lie. I am so frustrated and shocked by this behavior that I am going to put our experience on every possible search engine. If you do decide stay at this unprofessional establishment, take a recorder with you, just in case they are as dishonest with you as they were with us.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST”
Reviews.Author: Belladoll
Reviews.Content: This was simply the best play to stay. The housekeeping staff and maintance people keep this place up like a 5 * hotel. The front desk people were so very kind and helpful. The continental breakfast the kids loved ...McDonalds, always fresh and hot, so no complaints from us either. Nicely located to journey out from to take in Vancouvers' sites. Very quite, and a beautiful garden to step out into in the morning. We really enjoyed out stay, and would most definitly stay there again when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dubbelvla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Vancouver Metro hotel in May, 2006. It was our first hotel to visit during our vacation in Canada. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. In the lobby you could use the internet, but the rate was quite high. The continental breakfast was a coupon to get a free breakfast at McDonald's next door. We stayed for three nights and we only had breakfast at McDonald's one time. The hotel isn't in downtown, but it is easy accessible by car. I think it is a nice hotel if you don't want to spend very much in a hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 of us came to Vancouver from Washington, DC to see the NHL Awards show and Draft. We found this hotel because the reviews looked reasonable, and they had rooms available when others in town closer to downtown did not, at any price. One lady in our group broke her leg weeks prior and had a terrible time dealing with all the steps - up to the lobby, down to the rooms, down to the parking lot. There was more room in the closet than in the bathroom, and they were paying for a deluxe room, but one wasn't available. At least they had a room - the hotel cancelled our reservation because we were told at the desk there was a problem with the credit card. When we asked why they didn't contact us, they said they get bad credit card numbers all the time and they deal with this problem by just cancelling the reservations. Plus they had no rooms available. They called and found a room for us at the Eldorado three blocks down, for less money, and $5 off per person towards breakfast every morning. With the same credit card that the Days Inn had problems with - we figured they got the numbers mixed up or something. The two ladies ended up checking out the next day and went to the Crowne Plaza Hotel Georgia. When we checked on the fellow, who ended up staying at the hotel, that we were coming to pick him up on the last day of the trip, we were told he already checked out. Before we had a chance to ask if he was in the lobby, the phone was disconnected. He ended up walking and eating with us at the hotel we were at a couple of days because he got tired of McDonald's and didn't want to be alone. We'll never stay at a Days Inn ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: EdmTraveller101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on a business/holiday trip in October 2005. I booked the hotel through their website and the price was great for Vancouver. Getting there I realized that it was not right in the downtown area and had previously booked a rental car, however, once I arrived and realized how close all the public transport was, I cancelled the car. Myflight into Vancouver arrived quite early in the morning (approximately 9am) so I had called the hotel from the airport to see if it was possible to store my luggage there until check in at 3pm. The staff at the front desk advised me that my room was already vacated and had been cleaned so was welcome to come check in anytime and they did not charge extra for that. Upon my arrival, the room was as I had booked-furnished with a king bed, desk, phone, high speed internet, bathroom, and a huge closet with luggage holder and clothing rod/hangers to hang clothes. The room itself did not have a coffee maker, however, the lobby had fresh coffee 24 hours a day and vending machines for specialty coffees, pop, and snacks. The room was also spotless and was cleaned daily during the five nights I stayed. The hotel itself is located on Kingsway Avenue with buses going directly to Stanley Park in one direction and to Metro Town Mall in the other. There was a McDonalds next door where the room price included a continental breakfast there. There is also a large Petrocan with a Tim Hortons next to that. In the area there are many restaurants and cafes on Kingsway within a 5 to 10 minute walk. The skytrain terminal is also a 5 minute walk from the hotel and this takes you directly downtown or to connections to China Town, Granville Island, and any of the other tourist areas you wish to see. The hotel also provides maps with specific directions to everywhere, which I used throughout the entire stay. Honestly, I can't say enough about the service at this hotel. The staff there were fabulous and knowledgable. All were friendly and assisted with any requests no matter what they were. While the hotel itself is not a five star hotel, the service definitely is!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to be in Vancouver without spending a lot of money. It is NOT a downtown hotel, however it is a quick walk to a SkyTrain station (Nanaimo), and it's a quick 10-min ride to the downtown core, and the SkyTrain comes every couple of minutes, runs from early morning until late at night, and provides some nice views of the city. The area is nice, right next to a McDonald's and other restaurants. Well-maintained courtyard at the hotel where you can sit outside your room. Quiet. Rooms are small, but clean and well-kept. Staff was incredibly nice and helped us with everything from getting around Vancouver to helping us find the best way to make a day-trip to Seattle. Great price, great place to stay for the price if you don't mind not being downtown. We were three people in our room and were comfortable. If I go back to BC in the future I'll likely return to this hotel.
